title: Israel Plans to Withdraw Some Troops From Gaza
description: Reservists from at least two brigades will be sent home this week, and another three brigades will return to Israel for training, the military said.
content: Israeli soldiers walk near the border with Israel on Sunday.
author: Aaron Boxerman
tags: Israel-Gaza War (2023- ), Defense and Military Forces, Gaza Strip, Israel

title: Half of Gazans Are at Risk of Starving, U.N. Warns
description: More than 90 percent of Palestinians in the territory say they have regularly gone without food for a whole day, according to the United Nations.
content: Palestinians crowded in to get a free meal in the city of Rafah in southern Gaza last month.
author: Liam Stack, Gaya Gupta and Abu Bakr Bashir
authors: Liam Stack, Gaya Gupta and Abu Bakr Bashir
tags: Israel-Gaza War (2023- ), Food, Palestinians, Refugees and Displaced Persons, Hamas, United Nations, World Food Program

title: U.S.-Israel Relationship Shows Signs of Strain Amid War Against Hamas
description: No other episode in the past half-century has tested the relationship between the United States and Israel in such an intense and consequential way as the Israel-Hamas war of 2023.
content: President Biden has pressed Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to scale back the war to a surgical operation relying more on special forces raids than wide-scale bombing.
author: Peter Baker, Edward Wong, Julian E. Barnes and Isabel Kershner
authors: Peter Baker, Edward Wong, Julian E. Barnes and Isabel Kershner

title: New State Laws Will Affect Americans Starting Jan. 1, 2024
description: Many state laws take effect on the first day of 2024, including new rules on gun safety, a ban on diversity programs and a curb on telemarketing calls.
content: Gov. Tim Walz of Minnesota holds up a just-signed gun control bill in May at the Minnesota State Capitol. The new law includes universal background checks and a red flag-style provision.
author: Adeel Hassan

title: It’s 2024. Here Are the New Laws That New Yorkers Should Know About.
description: Legislation touching on nearly every aspect of life in the state, including wages, health care and education, is going into effect in the coming months.
content: Last year, Gov. Kathy Hochul signed bills that will require Medicaid to cover doula services and prohibit discrimination against L.G.B.T.Q. residents of nursing homes.

title: Appeals Court Allows California Ban on Guns in Most Public Places to Take Effect
description: A federal appeals court halted a lower court’s block on the law, which prohibits firearms in certain places such as playgrounds and libraries, allowing it to take effect on Monday.
content: Gov. Gavin Newsom of California signed a series of gun safety measures, including Senate Bill 2, into law in September.
author: Colbi Edmonds
tags: Firearms, California, Appeals Courts (US)

title: These Classic Characters Are Losing Copyright Protection. They May Never Be the Same.
description: What could happen to the original version of Mickey Mouse and others when they enter the public domain on Jan. 1? Hint: think Winnie the Pooh wielding a sledgehammer.
content: The “Steamboat Willie” version of Mickey Mouse enters the public domain on Jan. 1.
author: Sopan Deb
tags: Books and Literature, Copyrights and Copyright Violations, Winnie-the-Pooh (Fictional Character), Writing and Writers, Mickey Mouse (Fictional Character)

title: Trump Team, Burned in 2016, Looks to Close Out Iowa
description: The former president is leading by impressive margins in the state, but his campaign wants to make sure his supporters turn out.
content: A rally for former President Donald J. Trump last month in Cedar Rapids, Iowa. “The poll numbers are scary, because we’re leading by so much,” Mr. Trump has said. “The key is you have to get out and vote.”
author: Michael Gold and Kellen Browning
tags: Presidential Election of 2024, Primaries and Caucuses, Trump, Donald J, Iowa, Republican Party

title: Sununu Says Christie Should Drop Out Ahead of New Hampshire Primary
description: Mr. Sununu, the state’s governor, expressed concern that Mr. Christie would pull support from his preferred candidate, Nikki Haley.
content: Gov. Chris Sununu, Republican of New Hampshire, urged Chris Christie to drop out of the race for the party’s presidential nomination.
author: Anjali Huynh
tags: Christie, Christopher J, Haley, Nikki R, New Hampshire, Presidential Election of 2024, Republican Party

title: They Said ‘I Do’ in a Moscow Prison
description: She’s 18. He’s 23. He sent her a one-sentence letter through his prison’s electronic mail system: “Will you marry me?” They wed in a small room in a Moscow jail.
content: Yegor Shtovba, right at rear, and a fellow defendant, Artyom Kamardin, at a Moscow court in December, with guards in the foreground.
author: Valerie Hopkins
tags: Weddings and Engagements, Prisons and Prisoners, Human Rights and Human Rights Violations, Freedom of Speech and Expression, Political Prisoners, Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022)

title: Trump’s Most Ambitious Argument in His Bid for ‘Absolute Immunity’
description: The former president says his acquittal by the Senate in his second impeachment trial, for inciting insurrection, bars any prosecution on similar grounds.

title: Chill in the Housing Market Seeps Into Other Industries
description: The slowdown in the residential real estate market, a crucial cog in the American economy, is threatening sectors like home improvement and storage.
content: Sales of existing homes, which make up the majority of the housing stock in the United States, were down roughly 7 percent in November from a year earlier.

title: Asian American Officials Cite Unfair Scrutiny and Lost Jobs in China Spy Tensions
description: National security employees with ties to Asia say U.S. counterintelligence officers wrongly regard them as potential spies and ban them from jobs.

title: How to Start the New Year? Keep the Sea Goddess Happy.
